text:
to experience a bit.
see http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/sandbox/trunk-mvn-build/README.TXT

build distrib with skipping tests
svn co  https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/sandbox/trunk-mvn-build
cd trunk-mvn-build
mvn clean install -DskipTests
cd apache-tomcat/target/apache-tomcat-7.0.24-SNAPSHOT-bin/apache-tomcat-7.0.24-SNAPSHOT/bin/
./startup.sh

creator: jieryn@gmail.com
text: +1 -- fits in with our existing infrastructure better, please consider
+1, even though I personally prefer Ant, most companies have switched to Maven, and it has become more important for Tomcat's build to integrate seamlessly in that build environment.
creator: jason.brittain@gmail.com

text:
The general view of the current Tomcat devs on the dev list[1] was "Show us a working Maven build for Tomcat trunk that produces the same output as 'ant release' and we'll take a look. If it is better we'll use it."

To date, a working Maven build has not been produced.

Feel free to re-open this issue once such a build is available.

Please try to refrain from commenting on this issue unless you have something substantive to add. If you want to continue any of the debate from [1], please do so on the Tomcat dev list.

[1] http://markmail.org/thread/cp2czoud67m7qfb5
creator: markt@apache.org
